intro: Maltebrunia gabonensis, commonly known as the Gabon sandbush, is a shrub native to the rainforests of Gabon. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, and it is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical environments. Maltebrunia gabonensis is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
